name: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid has a melting point that we can compare to benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 120 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for this compound can be considered 3-methoxybenzoic acid, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius due to the introduction of the methoxy group, which increases the molecular weight and size, and also introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential. The hydroxyl group also contributes to the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity of the structure, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group introduces a rigid structure and potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group also introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
